sn6.5:1.2: Now at that time a certain Brahmā had the following harmful misconception:
sn6.5:1.3: “No ascetic or brahmin can come here!”
sn6.5:1.4: Then the Buddha knew what that Brahmā was thinking. As easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that Brahmā realm.
sn6.5:1.5: Then the Buddha sat cross-legged in the air above that Brahmā, having entered upon the fire element.
sn6.5:2.2: “Where is the Buddha staying at present?”
sn6.5:2.3: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, he saw the Buddha seated cross-legged in the air above that Brahmā, having entered upon the fire element.
sn6.5:2.4: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that Brahmā realm.
sn6.5:2.5: Then Mahāmoggallāna—positioning himself in the east, below the Buddha—sat cross-legged in the air above that Brahmā, having entered upon the fire element.
sn6.5:5.5: positioned himself in the north, below the Buddha, sitting cross-legged in the air above that Brahmā, having entered upon the fire element.
sn6.5:6.1: Then Mahāmoggallāna addressed that Brahmā in verse:
sn6.5:7.1: “Sir, do you still have the same view
sn6.5:7.2: that you had in the past?
sn6.5:7.3: Or do you see the radiance
sn6.5:8.1: “Good sir, I don’t have that view
sn6.5:8.2: that I had in the past.
sn6.5:8.5: So how could I say today
sn6.5:8.6: that I am permanent and eternal?”
sn6.5:9.1: Having inspired a sense of awe in the Brahmā, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, the Buddha vanished from the Brahmā realm and reappeared in Jeta’s Grove.
sn6.5:9.2: Then that Brahmā addressed a member of his retinue,
sn6.5:9.3: “Please, good sir, go up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna and say to him:
sn6.5:9.4: ‘Moggallāna my good sir, are there any other disciples of the Buddha who have power and might
sn6.5:9.5: comparable to the masters Moggallāna, Kassapa, Kappina, and Anuruddha?’”
sn6.5:9.6: “Yes, good sir,” replied that retinue member. He went to Moggallāna and asked as instructed.
sn6.5:9.9: Then Mahāmoggallāna addressed that member of Brahmā’s retinue in verse:
sn6.5:10.1: “There are many disciples of the Buddha
sn6.5:10.3: and have attained psychic power, expert in reading minds,
sn6.5:10.4: they’re perfected ones with defilements ended.”
sn6.5:11.1: Then that member of Brahmā’s retinue, having approved and agreed with what Mahāmoggallāna said, went to that Brahmā and said to him,
sn6.5:12.1: ‘There are many disciples of the Buddha
sn6.5:12.3: and have attained psychic power, expert in reading minds,
sn6.5:12.4: they’re perfected ones with defilements ended.’”
sn6.5:13.1: That’s what that member of Brahmā’s retinue said.
sn6.5:13.2: Satisfied, that Brahmā was happy with what the member of his retinue said.
